exceptions.tactic: intros Hgroup Hcomm x y Hx Hy.

exceptions.exn: In environment S : Set G : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S O : S Opp : S -> S H : is_group H0 : commutativity S Add x, y : S H1 : G x H2 : G y Unable to unify "Add (Opp x) (Opp y)" with "Opp (Add x y)".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
S: Set
G: S -> Prop
Add: S -> S -> S
O: S
Opp: S -> S

Goal:
is_group -> commutativity S Add -> forall x y : S, G x -> G y -> Opp (Add x y) = Add (Opp x) (Opp y)

Premises:
commutativity : forall S : Set, (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
is_group = intern S G Add /\ associativity S Add /\ neutral S G Add O /\ opposite S G Add O Opp : Prop
opp_com : forall (S : Set) (G : S -> Prop) (Add : S -> S -> S) (O : S), commutativity S Add -> forall x y : S, G x -> G y -> Add x y = O -> is_opposite S G Add O x y
opp_unicity : is_group -> forall x y : S, is_opposite S G Add O x y -> y = Opp x
opp_opp : is_group -> forall x : S, G x -> x = Opp (Opp x)
regular_l : is_group -> forall y z : S, G y -> G z -> forall x : S, G x -> Add x y = Add x z -> y = z
Fin.L_R : forall n : nat, Fin.t ?m -> Fin.t (n + ?m) where ?m : [S : Set G : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S O : S Opp : S -> S |- nat]
add_add : commutativity S Add -> associativity S Add -> forall x1 y1 x2 y2 : S, Add (Add x1 y1) (Add x2 y2) = Add (Add x1 x2) (Add y1 y2)
inv_com : forall (S : Set) (Mult : S -> S -> S) (I x : S), commutativity S Mult -> (exists y : S, Mult x y = I) -> inversible S Mult I x
VectorDef.caseS : forall P : forall n : nat, VectorDef.t ?A (Datatypes.S n) -> Type, (forall (h : ?A) (n : nat) (t : VectorDef.t ?A n), P n (VectorDef.cons ?A h n t)) -> forall (n : nat) (v : VectorDef.t ?A (Datatypes.S n)), P n v where ?A : [S : Set G : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S O : S Opp : S -> S |- Type]
VectorDef.rectS : forall P : forall n : nat, VectorDef.t ?A (Datatypes.S n) -> Type, (forall a : ?A, P 0 (VectorDef.cons ?A a 0 (VectorDef.nil ?A))) -> (forall (a : ?A) (n : nat) (v : VectorDef.t ?A (Datatypes.S n)), P n v -> P (Datatypes.S n) (VectorDef.cons ?A a (Datatypes.S n) v)) -> forall (n : nat) (v : VectorDef.t ?A (Datatypes.S n)), P n v where ?A : [S : Set G : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S O : S Opp : S -> S |- Type]
is_opposite : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> S -> S -> Prop
inversible : forall S : Set, (S -> S -> S) -> S -> S -> Prop
ssrfun.interchange : forall S : Type, (S -> S -> S) -> (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
neutral : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> Prop
opposite : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> (S -> S) -> Prop
associativity : forall S : Set, (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
intern : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
Ring_theory.mkmorph : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), req (phi cO) rO -> req (phi cI) rI -> (forall x y : C, req (phi (cadd x y)) (radd (phi x) (phi y))) -> (forall x y : C, req (phi (csub x y)) (rsub (phi x) (phi y))) -> (forall x y : C, req (phi (cmul x y)) (rmul (phi x) (phi y))) ->...-> Ring_theory.ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi
Ring_theory.SRIDmorph : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> forall reqb : R -> R -> bool, (forall x y : R, reqb x y = true -> req x y) -> Ring_theory.ring_morph rO rI radd rmul (Ring_theory.SRsub radd) (Ring_theory.SRopp (R:=R)) req rO rI radd rmul (Ring_theory.SRsub radd) (Ring_theory.SRopp (R:=R)) reqb (Ring_theory.IDphi (R:=R))
Record ring_morph (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R) : Prop := mkmorph { morph0 : req (phi cO) rO; morph1 : req (phi cI) rI; morph_add : forall x y : C, req (phi (cadd x y)) (radd (phi x) (phi y)); morph_sub : forall x y : C, req (phi (csub x y)) (rsub (phi x) (phi y)); morph_mul : forall x y : C, req (phi (cmul x y)) (rmul (phi x) (phi y)); morph_opp : forall x : C, req (phi (copp x)) (ropp (phi x)); morph_eq : forall...
BinNat.N.lt = fun x y : BinNums.N => BinNat.N.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.lt (_ _)%N_scope
BinPos.Pos.lt = fun x y : BinNums.positive => BinPos.Pos.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> Prop Arguments BinPos.Pos.lt (_ _)%positive_scope
BinInt.Z.lt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
BinPos.Pos.gt = fun x y : BinNums.positive => BinPos.Pos.compare x y = Gt : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> Prop Arguments BinPos.Pos.gt (_ _)%positive_scope
Eqdep.EqdepTheory.eq_dep_eq : forall (U : Type) (P : U -> Type) (p : U) (x y : P p), EqdepFacts.eq_dep U P p x p y -> x = y
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
BinPos.Pos.le = fun x y : BinNums.positive => BinPos.Pos.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> Prop Arguments BinPos.Pos.le (_ _)%positive_scope
ssrbool.canLR_in : forall (T1 T2 : ssrbool.predArgType) (D1 : ssrbool.pred_sort (ssrbool.predPredType T1)) (f : T1 -> T2) (g : T2 -> T1) (x : T2) (y : T1), ssrbool.prop_in1 (ssrbool.mem D1) (P:=fun x0 : T1 => g (f x0) = x0) (ssrbool.inPhantom (ssrfun.cancel f g)) -> is_true (ssrbool.in_mem y (ssrbool.mem D1)) -> x = f y -> g x = y
BinInt.Z.divide = fun x y : BinNums.Z => exists z : BinNums.Z, y = BinInt.Z.mul z x : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.divide (_ _)%Z_scope
ZMicromega.eq_cnf : forall x : BinNums.Z, (BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 (BinInt.Z.sub x (BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH)) -> False) /\ (BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 (BinInt.Z.sub (BinNums.Zneg BinNums.xH) x) -> False) < -> x = BinNums.Z0
ssrbool.prop_in1 : forall T1 : Type, ssrbool.mem_pred T1 -> forall P : T1 -> Prop, ssreflect.phantom Prop (forall x : T1, P x) -> Prop
Zbool.Zeq_bool = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match BinInt.Z.compare x y with | Eq => true | _ => false end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> bool Arguments Zbool.Zeq_bool (_ _)%Z_scope
BinPosDef.Pos.sub = fun x y : BinNums.positive => match BinPosDef.Pos.sub_mask x y with | BinPosDef.Pos.IsPos z => z | _ => BinNums.xH end : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.sub (_ _)%positive_scope
ZMicromega.le_neg : forall x : BinNums.Z, (BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 x -> False) < -> BinInt.Z.lt BinNums.Z0 (BinInt.Z.opp x)
Inductive Zis_gcd (a b g : BinNums.Z) : Prop := Zis_gcd_intro : BinInt.Z.divide g a -> BinInt.Z.divide g b -> (forall x : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.divide x a -> BinInt.Z.divide x b -> BinInt.Z.divide x g) -> Znumtheory.Zis_gcd a b g Arguments Znumtheory.Zis_gcd (_ _ _)%Z_scope Arguments Znumtheory.Zis_gcd_intro (_ _ _)%Z_scope _ _ _%function_scope
Inductive ascii : Set := Ascii : bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> Ascii.ascii Arguments Ascii.Ascii (_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _)%bool_scope
Ring_polynom.norm_subst : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> nat -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C) -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
Ring_theory.SRsub : forall R : Type, (R -> R -> R) -> R -> R -> R
Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C * Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C)
Ring_polynom.Peq : forall C : Type, (C -> C -> bool) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> bool
ZMicromega.le_0_iff : forall x y : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le x y < -> BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 (BinInt.Z.sub y x)

```coq
intros.
intros Hgroup Hcomm x y Hx Hy.
unfold is_group in Hgroup.
destruct Hgroup as [Hintern [Hassoc [Hneutral [Hopp _]]]].
unfold commutativity in Hcomm.
unfold commutativity in Hcomm.
apply Hneutral in Hx. apply Hneutral in Hy.
rewrite Hx, Hy.
rewrite Hopp.
rewrite Hopp.
rewrite Hassoc.
rewrite (add_add _ Hassoc x y (Opp x) (Opp y)).
reflexivity.
Qed.
```

original: intros. intros Hgroup Hcomm x y Hx Hy. unfold is_group in Hgroup. destruct Hgroup as [Hintern [Hassoc [Hneutral [Hopp _]]]]. unfold commutativity in Hcomm. unfold commutativity in Hcomm. apply Hneutral in Hx. apply Hneutral in Hy. rewrite Hx, Hy. rewrite Hopp. rewrite Hopp. rewrite Hassoc. rewrite (add_add _ Hassoc x y (Opp x) (Opp y)). reflexivity.
